intro: Gomphocentrum guillauminii, commonly known as the Guillaumin's gomphocentrum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
